instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging/no orange light
threads.message: Thinks look ok around the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> area.  I'm measuring  15.67v on charger bgate line, Is that normal for this board?  it's around 12.5 on a 3115 I have sitting here.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging/no orange light
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> wasn't switching on, swapped from a donor and now I'm getting 11.6v out was getting 0v before.  Light is still not turning orange.
Board had extensive water damage.  Backlight fix <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> and keyboard connector changeout.
Battery is a known good.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging/no orange light
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> are good and I have continuity from the ISL to the battery through the traces

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging/no orange light
threads.message: First measure resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>. Was there liquid around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>? Also PPBUS voltage without battery connected?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging/no orange light
threads.message: 27-28 is 20.55 ohm.  17-18 is 3.05 ohm. PPBUS is 15.7v

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging/no orange light
threads.message: PPBUS is way too high. <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> probably shorted. Replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/35 and the ISL.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging/no orange light
threads.message: Great success!  Thanks Duke, that solved it.  This board was covered in corrosion and I was surprised that it booted in the first place.
